REFERENCE: Mario A. Salgado-Galvez, Alex H. Barbat, Omar Dario Cardona, Martha Liliana Carreno, Comparing observed damages and losses with modelled ones using a probabilistic approach: The Lorca 2011 case, International Journal of Disaster Risk Reduction, Volume 19, 2016, Pages 355-365, ISSN 2212-4209, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijdrr.2016.09.008.

Rojo, M. B., Beck, E., and Lutoff, C.: The street as an area of human exposure in an earthqauek aftermath: the case of Lorca, Spain, 2011, Nat. Nazards Earth Syst. Sci., 17, 581-594. https://doi.org/10.5194/nhess-17-581-2017, 2017.
COMMENTS: The casualties were caused in streets near buildings and were due not to collapsing buildings but to falling cornices, balconies and other facade elements (Martinez Moreno et al., 2012).

REFERENCE: Alvarez, Victor. (2016). Perdidas economicas ocasionadas por el terremoto de Lorca del 11 de mayo de 2011.
COMMENTS: 889 Buildings damaged only in the city of Lorca
